content.raw:
With the current setup, service end point returns code 500 \(internal server error\). 

‌
content.html:
With the current setup, service end point returns code 500 (internal server error).

‌

Template part of service input is:

{
    "imageProperties": {
      "width": 0,
      "height": 0
    },
    "templateAnnotations": [
      {
        "originX": 0,
        "originY": 0,
        "width": 0,
        "height": 0,
        "visualObjectClass": "string"
      }]
}

and this is different than the .json file in the ticket. Just wanted to make sure if IO is going to convert the .json files to the class above?

content.raw:
Which difference you mean? the two proper named SEK files are without the imageproperties. If this is what you mean. the just named SEK one is the one IO how IO is gonna convert the file.  
Or do you mean that the boxes got additional information? like all the additional attributes?
content.html:
Which difference you mean? the two proper named SEK files are without the imageproperties. If this is what you mean. the just named SEK one is the one IO how IO is gonna convert the file.
Or do you mean that the boxes got additional information? like all the additional attributes?

content.raw: I meant the latter. Extra attributes.

As far as i know pydantic simply ignores them via the default config. but could be wrong  
[https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/api/config/#pydantic.config.ConfigDict.extra](https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/api/config/#pydantic.config.ConfigDict.extra){: data-inline-card='' }
content.html:
As far as i know pydantic simply ignores them via the default config. but could be wrong
https://docs.pydantic.dev/latest/api/config/#pydantic.config.ConfigDict.extra

content.html: Did you make it work with SEK.json? For me it doesn’t work that way.

content.raw: yeah because the boxes of the input image is missing customerdata.josn is just the annotation data
content.html: yeah because the boxes of the input image is missing customerdata.josn is just the annotation data

content.raw:
That shouldn’t be the issue. The worst case it would return bad results. But I get code 422 which indicates bad input. However the reason for that is not simply extra inputs but some extra inputs such as:

```
      "_id" : ObjectId("65"),
```

the values of key “id” is instance of ObjectId which is not know by the endpoint.

‌

The extra inputs like this is fine:

```
      "@id" : "<some link",
```

‌
content.html:

the values of key “id” is instance of ObjectId which is not know by the endpoint.
